David_James_(singer):
{{short description|Canadian country pop singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2019}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = David James | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_date = | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Winnipeg]], Manitoba, Canada{{cite news|last1=Melanson|first1=Jenna|title=Interview – David James|url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2015/10/15/interview-david-james/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Canadian Beats|date=October 15, 2015}} | origin = | instrument = | genre = [[Country pop]]{{cite news|title=David James - Spotify|url=https://open.spotify.com/artist/6JKG9xGqoyj7oMHF0ta147?si=C2heO-xTSKuz4Rxylx6mJw|accessdate=March 23, 2020|work=[[Spotify]]}} | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2013–present | label = [[MDM Recordings Inc.|MDM]] | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|davidjamesmusic.ca/}} }} '''David James''' is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter. James was nominated for the 2014 [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Discovery Award and 2017 Rising Star Award.{{cite news|title=Media Release: Top Six Finalists Announced For The 2014 CCMA Discovery Program|url=http://www.ccma.org/cgi/page.cgi/_article.html/News/Media_Release_Top_Six_Finalists_Announced_for_the_2014_CCMA_Discovery_Program-2014-06-11|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[Canadian Country Music Association]]|date=April 30, 2014|archive-date=March 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160302194551/http://www.ccma.org/cgi/page.cgi/_article.html/News/Media_Release_Top_Six_Finalists_Announced_for_the_2014_CCMA_Discovery_Program-2014-06-11|url-status=dead}} ==Career== In August 2014, he signed to [[MDM Recordings Inc.]]{{cite news|last1=Harr|first1=Dan|title=MDM Recordings Inc. Signs CCMA Nominee David James|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/mdm-recordings-inc-signs-ccma-nominee-david-james/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Music News Nashville|date=August 14, 2014|archive-date=March 3, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303020057/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/mdm-recordings-inc-signs-ccma-nominee-david-james/|url-status=dead}} His first single for the label, "What We Weren't Looking For", was released in February 2015.{{cite news|title=David James Releases New Single "What We Weren't Looking For"|url=http://cmrnashville.com/news-details.php?id=20957|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=CMR Nashville|date=February 18, 2015|archive-date=March 1, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160301193335/http://cmrnashville.com/news-details.php?id=20957|url-status=dead}} A music video for the song debuted on [[CMT (Canadian TV channel)|CMT]] in March. The song peaked at number 27 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart in June. James' second single for MDM, "Some Hearts", was released in September.{{cite news|last1=Melanson|first1=Jenna|title=New single released by David James|url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2015/09/29/new-single-released-by-david-james/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Canadian Beats|date=September 29, 2015}} His third single for the label, "Lonely Girl", was released on March 8, 2016.{{cite news|last1=Dagg|first1=Nanci|title=Interview – David James|url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2016/02/14/interview-david-james-2/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Canadian Beats|date=February 14, 2016}} All three songs are included on an [[extended play]], ''Songs About a Girl'', released on March 11. In 2020, James released the extended play ''[[If I Were You (EP)|If I Were You]]'', which included the singles "Cars, Girls, And The Radio",{{cite web|title=David James releases new single, "Cars, Girls, & The Radio"|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2018/11/06/david-james-releases-new-single-cars-girls-the-radio/|work=Canadian Beats Media|first=Amanda|last=Hather|date=November 6, 2018}} "All the Time",{{cite web|title=EXCLUSIVE PREMIERE: David James "All The Time"|url=https://www.completecountry.ca/article.php?article_id=5362|work=Complete Country|date=October 15, 2019}} and the title track whose co-writers include [[Tyler Hubbard]] of [[Florida Georgia Line]] and [[Hardy (singer)|Hardy]].{{cite news|title= CANADIAN COUNTRY ARTIST DAVID JAMES DELIVERS NEW EP "IF I WERE YOU", AVAILABLE TODAY|url= https://davidjamesmusic.ca/canadian-country-artist-david-james-delivers-new-ep-if-i-were-you-available-today/ |accessdate=March 31, 2020|work=David James Official Website|date=March 13, 2020}}{{cite web|title=David James releases new EP, If I Were You |url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2020/03/25/david-james-releases-new-ep-if-i-were-you/ |work=Canadian Beats Media|first=Max|last=Reid|date=March 25, 2020}}{{cite web|title=Top Country Pick: David James 'If I Were You'|url=https://topcountry.ca/top-country-pick-david-james-if-i-were-you/|work=Top Country|date=March 13, 2020}} ==Discography== ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !
